meanings.sent1: In the city, the demic of young adults is growing rapidly.
meanings.sent2: The demic of retirees in this area is quite large.
meanings.sent3: At the picnic, the demic of ice cream lovers was evident.
meanings.sent4: The demic of bookworms in the library was like a silent army.
meanings.sent5: The demic of soccer fans made the stadium roar with excitement.

meanings.definition: A person who is a member of a particular demographic group
meanings.sent1: She is a demic of the local art community.
meanings.sent2: The demic of tech enthusiasts is always eager to try new gadgets.
meanings.sent3: The demic of coffee lovers in the office never runs out of energy.
meanings.sent4: He stood out as a demic of fashionistas with his unique style.
meanings.sent5: As a demic of nature lovers, she always seeks outdoor adventures.

meanings.definition: Relating to or characteristic of a particular population or group
meanings.sent1: The demic trends show an increase in online shopping.
meanings.sent2: Her demic background influenced her taste in music.
meanings.sent3: The demic preferences for spicy food surprised the chef.
meanings.sent4: His demic style of painting was admired by art critics.
meanings.sent5: The demic traditions of the community were celebrated during the festival.
